entry.title: Setting up your workstation
entry.content: This first guide will walk you through a step-by-step installation of the required tools to start developing applications on Symbol.
entry.summary: This first guide will walk you through a step-by-step installation of the required tools to start developing applications on Symbol.

entry.title: Creating an account
entry.content: Create a new Symbol account to start sending and receiving transactions.
entry.summary: Create a new Symbol account to start sending and receiving transactions.

entry.title: Getting the account information
entry.content: Get the public key and balance of an account.
entry.summary: Get the public key and balance of an account.

entry.title: Sending mosaics and messages between two accounts
entry.content: Define, sign, and announce a transfer transaction.
entry.summary: Define, sign, and announce a transfer transaction.

entry.title: Sending multiple transactions together
entry.content: Send transactions to different accounts at the same time, using aggregate transactions.
entry.summary: Send transactions to different accounts at the same time, using aggregate transactions.

entry.title: Creating an escrow contract
entry.content: Learn about aggregate bonded transactions creating an escrow contract.
entry.summary: Learn about aggregate bonded transactions creating an escrow contract.

entry.title: Cosigning aggregate bonded transactions automatically
entry.content: Create a bot to cosign automatically transactions that require your account’s signature.
entry.summary: Create a bot to cosign automatically transactions that require your account’s signature.

entry.title: Creating a mosaic
entry.content: Tokenize an asset using mosaics.
entry.summary: Tokenize an asset using mosaics.

entry.title: Creating a multisig account
entry.content: This guide will show you how to setup a joint account.
entry.summary: This guide will show you how to setup a joint account.

entry.title: Getting a block by height
entry.content: Get the block information given a height.
entry.summary: Get the block information given a height.

entry.title: Registering a namespace
entry.content: Create a unique name to identify your assets.
entry.summary: Create a unique name to identify your assets.

entry.title: Adding a new signer to a multisig account
entry.content: This guide will show you how to add a new cosignatory to a multisig account.
entry.summary: This guide will show you how to add a new cosignatory to a multisig account.

entry.title: Modifying a multisig account min approval
entry.content: This guide will show you how to increase and decrease the minimum number of signatures needed to execute a multisig transaction.
entry.summary: This guide will show you how to increase and decrease the minimum number of signatures needed to execute a multisig transaction.

entry.title: Removing a signer from a multisig account
entry.content: This guide will show you how to remove a cosignatory from a multisig account.
entry.summary: This guide will show you how to remove a cosignatory from a multisig account.

entry.title: Atomic cross-chain swap between public and private chain
entry.content: Trade tokens between different blockchains without using an intermediary party in the process.
entry.summary: Trade tokens between different blockchains without using an intermediary party in the process.

entry.title: Cosigning aggregate bonded transactions
entry.content: Cosign aggregate transactions pending to be signed.
entry.summary: Cosign aggregate transactions pending to be signed.

entry.title: Creating a multi-level multisig account
entry.content: This guide will show you how to connect multiple multisig accounts to achieve advanced on-chain authorization logic.
entry.summary: This guide will show you how to connect multiple multisig accounts to achieve advanced on-chain authorization logic.

entry.title: Creating a subnamespace
entry.content: Once you have a registered root namespace, you can create up to 3 levels of subnamespaces to organize your assets.
entry.summary: Once you have a registered root namespace, you can create up to 3 levels of subnamespaces to organize your assets.

entry.title: Getting the amount of assets sent to an account
entry.content: Check the number of asset units you have sent to an account.
entry.summary: Check the number of asset units you have sent to an account.

entry.title: Listening to new blocks
entry.content: Get notified when a new block is included.
entry.summary: Get notified when a new block is included.

entry.title: Modifying the mosaic supply
entry.content: If a mosaic was created with the “Supply Mutable” property, you can make more tokens or reduce the total supply.
entry.summary: If a mosaic was created with the “Supply Mutable” property, you can make more tokens or reduce the total supply.

entry.title: Reading transactions from an account
entry.content: Get the complete list of transactions involving an account.
entry.summary: Get the complete list of transactions involving an account.

entry.title: Turning the asynchronous transaction announcement into synchronous
entry.content: Handy snippet to announce a transaction and wait until this is confirmed.
entry.summary: Handy snippet to announce a transaction and wait until this is confirmed.

entry.title: Sending a multisig transaction
entry.content: This guide will show you how to issue transactions from a multisig account.
entry.summary: This guide will show you how to issue transactions from a multisig account.

entry.title: Linking a namespace to a mosaic
entry.content: Alias an mosaic with a namespace so that others can reference it in a more friendly way when issuing transactions.
entry.summary: Alias an mosaic with a namespace so that others can reference it in a more friendly way when issuing transactions.

entry.title: Linking a namespace to an address
entry.content: Alias an address with a namespace so that others can reference the account in a more friendly way when issuing transactions.
entry.summary: Alias an address with a namespace so that others can reference the account in a more friendly way when issuing transactions.

entry.title: Getting the mosaic information
entry.content: Get the ownership, divisibility, duration, and flags for a given mosaic identifier.
entry.summary: Get the ownership, divisibility, duration, and flags for a given mosaic identifier.

entry.title: Getting the namespace information
entry.content: Get the ownership and duration for a given namespace identifier.
entry.summary: Get the ownership and duration for a given namespace identifier.

entry.title: Preventing spam attacks with account restrictions
entry.content: Learn how to add and remove account restrictions.
entry.summary: Learn how to add and remove account restrictions.

entry.title: Sending an encrypted message
entry.content: Send an encrypted message that only can be read by the recipient account.
entry.summary: Send an encrypted message that only can be read by the recipient account.

entry.title: Extending a namespace registration period
entry.content: This guide shows you how to extend the rental period of a namespace.
entry.summary: This guide shows you how to extend the rental period of a namespace.

entry.title: Getting the asset identifier behind a namespace with receipts
entry.content: Get the resolution for a given alias and transaction using receipts.
entry.summary: Get the resolution for a given alias and transaction using receipts.

entry.title: Migrating from NIS1 to Symbol
entry.content: With Symbol, most of the previously available NIS1 features have evolved. This document will help you upgrade your application’s previous NIS1 features to the newly available Symbol technology.
entry.summary: With Symbol, most of the previously available NIS1 features have evolved. This document will help you upgrade your application’s previous NIS1 features to the newly available Symbol technology.

entry.title: Restricting mosaic transfers
entry.content: Limit how accounts can transact with Mosaic Restrictions.
entry.summary: Limit how accounts can transact with Mosaic Restrictions.

entry.title: Delegating mosaic restrictions to a third party
entry.content: Allow another account to add restrictions to your mosaics.
entry.summary: Allow another account to add restrictions to your mosaics.

entry.content: Add custom data to an account.
entry.summary: Add custom data to an account.

entry.summary: Add custom data to a mosaic.

entry.title: Private test networks
entry.content: This guide will walk you through the process of setting up your own private network using Symbol.
entry.summary: This guide will walk you through the process of setting up your own private network using Symbol.

entry.content: This guide walks you through the process of setting up a node to join Symbol’s public network.
entry.summary: This guide walks you through the process of setting up a node to join Symbol’s public network.

entry.title: Network properties
entry.content: There is a large number of network-related settings that can be customized in Symbol.
entry.summary: There is a large number of network-related settings that can be customized in Symbol.

entry.title: How to connect to MongoDB
entry.content: Learn how to access your API node’s MongoDB instance.
entry.summary: Learn how to access your API node’s MongoDB instance.

entry.title: Adding cosignatures to aggregate complete trasactions
entry.content: This guide will show you how to add cosignatures to an aggregate complete transaction without using the partial cache.
entry.summary: This guide will show you how to add cosignatures to an aggregate complete transaction without using the partial cache.

entry.title: Using Symbol Bootstrap
entry.content: How to use this handy node deployment tool.
entry.summary: How to use this handy node deployment tool.

entry.title: Activating delegated harvesting manually
entry.content: Share your account’s importance securely with a node and get rewarded.
entry.summary: Share your account’s importance securely with a node and get rewarded.

entry.title: Activating delegated harvesting using the Desktop Wallet
entry.content: Share your account’s importance securely with a node and get rewarded.
entry.summary: Share your account’s importance securely with a node and get rewarded.

entry.title: Activating remote harvesting
entry.content: Harvest new blocks through a proxy account for added security.
entry.summary: Harvest new blocks through a proxy account for added security.

entry.title: Running a node manually
entry.content: This guide walks you through the process of setting up a node to join Symbol’s network without using Symbol Bootstrap.
entry.summary: This guide walks you through the process of setting up a node to join Symbol’s network without using Symbol Bootstrap.

entry.title: Running a secure node
entry.content: How to run a Symbol node with added security.
entry.summary: How to run a Symbol node with added security.

entry.title: Non-custodial node setup
entry.content: How to relinquish control of a node’s main account to an external account, so that the external account’s private key is never required in the node setup process.
entry.summary: How to relinquish control of a node’s main account to an external account, so that the external account’s private key is never required in the node setup process.

entry.title: Retrieving your XYM from a pre-launch opt-in
entry.content: This guide explains how to access the XYM (Symbol’s native currency) you were awarded if you enrolled in the opt-in process BEFORE Symbol launched (March 12, 2021).
entry.summary: This guide explains how to access the XYM (Symbol’s native currency) you were awarded if you enrolled in the opt-in process BEFORE Symbol launched (March 12, 2021).

entry.title: Retrieving your XYM from a post-launch opt-in
entry.content: This guide explains how to enroll in the opt-in process once Symbol has launched (this is, after March 12, 2021).
entry.summary: This guide explains how to enroll in the opt-in process once Symbol has launched (this is, after March 12, 2021).

entry.title: Retrieving the global mosaic supply
entry.content: Different values regarding the total supply of symbol.xym are available in real-time, through REST endpoints on any Symbol API node. Click on each endpoint below for an example.
entry.summary: Different values regarding the total supply of symbol.xym are available in real-time, through REST endpoints on any Symbol API node. Click on each endpoint below for an example.

entry.title: Maintaining a Node
entry.content: How to keep your Symbol node up and running healthily.
